decision_conditions: work in accordance with British Standard
description: 3 x London planes (T7, T11, T19): Reduce crowns to previous most recent reduction points retaining selected shortened furnishing growths at cut points. 1 x London plane (T32): Reduce one limb back to previous most recent reduction point, (approximately 2-3m), thin out heavier denser branch ends by 15% & thin inner epicormic growth in the canopy by 50%. 1 x London plane (T31): Crown thin by 15 per cent including advanced epicormic growth within the canopy.1 x London plane (T14): Lift crown over Connaught Street to 4- 5 m from ground level and prune back selected branches from street lamp to provide 2 m clearance 1 x London plane (T15) Lift crown over Connaught Street to 4-5 m from ground level  1 x London plane (T16):  Crown thin denser canopy over road (east side) by 15 % and lift lower growth projecting north side to  4-5 m from ground level 1 x London plane (T21): Crown thin denser parts of canopy by 15% and thin inner epicormic in the canopy by 50% 3 x London planes (T1, T22, T23): crown thin by up to 25%  to ensure an even canopy density. 1 x cherry (T10): Reduce crown on south side by 2.5 m and reduce crown on north side by 0 .5m to balance
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
